sentences.english: The flowers give straight must admire, Mo to be whispering a beginning.

sentences.english: There are a few good places to watch from quite near home.
sentences.chinese: 我家附近就有几个相当好的赏鸟地点。

sentences.english: I've seen many people in London who are interested in bird watching.
sentences.chinese: 我看到伦敦很多人对赏鸟感兴趣。

sentences.english: Mike's boss slammed the door on his request for a job transfer.
sentences.chinese: 麦可要求调任时，他的老板赏了他闭门羹。

sentences.english: I really wanted to slap her during the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 在开会的时候我真想赏她一巴掌。

sentences.english: Spring has begun, and so has Japan's obsession with cherry blossoms。
sentences.chinese: 春天来了，日本各地的赏樱热潮也开始了。

sentences.english: Treat them with forms of propriety they like, reward them with what they love, then those you seek will come.
sentences.chinese: 士喜爱赏就用赏相示，这样，所求的人就会来到。

sentences.english: Treat them with forms of propriety they like, reward them with what they love, then those you seek will come.
sentences.chinese: 士喜爱赏就用赏相示，这样，所求的人就会来到。

sentences.english: My parents said, we went to the Shanghe.
sentences.chinese: 我对爸妈说，我们去赏荷吧。

sentences.english: One who pursues a criminal or fugitive for whom a reward is offered.
sentences.chinese: 为得赏而追捕缉拿罪犯或逃犯的人。

sentences.english: This is Mo Yan who has gotten the Nobel prise and he was the author we are pride of.
sentences.chinese: 这是莫言已经诺贝尔奖赏和作者他是我们的骄傲。

sentences.english: The dog thinks that people have to save up tours.
sentences.chinese: 狗以为只要把人救上来就有赏。

sentences.english: The family side of the rewards that big round moon while eating family dinner.
sentences.chinese: 全家人一边赏那又大又圆的月亮，一边吃着团圆饭。

sentences.english: A father and his children were down on the dock, admiring the sunset together.
sentences.chinese: 一个父亲与他的两个孩子站在河埠头上一起赏落日。

sentences.english: This day's important activity is watching lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 元宵节的重要活动是赏花灯。

sentences.english: If visitors have right solutions to the riddles, they will get a little gift.
sentences.chinese: 如果赏花灯的人猜中谜底，就会得到小礼物。
